description.overall_rewritten_sentence: While wines from the dillons point subregion of marlborough frequently exhibit a notably robust character in their sauvignon blancs, this particular vintage diverges somewhat from those typical traits. The herbal notes are prominent but well mannered, backed by plenty of mild citrus—think white grapefruit—and melon. Ample weight, a silky texture and a lengthy finish complete the package.
